reviews.snippet:
Great little hidden gem in the best of Ginza. A bit of an adventure to find, as it's located under the train tracks, but worth the discovery. Staff are super friendly, the layout is cozy yet comfy, and most importantly the food is delicious. I highly recommend the shoyu-based ramen 🍜

It's hard to find halal food in Tokyo, so this place really stands out. It's not just that there's no pork or alcohol -- everything is certified halal. There's even a prayer room in the restaurant, which is a super rarity here.

I highly recommend a visit here, even if you're not specifically looking for halal food. Just an all-around great place!

reviews.snippet:
Delicious Ramen & Great Atmosphere, But Be Prepared for the Price

This ramen spot offers a fantastic experience, even without pork on the menu! The chicken ramen was genuinely good, and the Wagyu ramen was a definite highlight. We loved the great atmosphere and received excellent service throughout our meal. The only real caveat is the price; it's quite expensive. If you're looking for quality ramen and don't mind spending a bit more, it's definitely worth checking out.
